nodes.text: FN-2000, nicknamed "Zeroes," was a human male stormtrooper in the military forces of the First Order. Assigned to the FN Corps, Zeroes trained alongside troopers FN-2003, FN-2187, and FN-2199 in the decades following the Galactic Civil War. He had dark brown skin and a healed, light-colored scar on his right cheek.

FN-2000, also known as "Zeroes," was a human male stormtrooper who served in the First Order in the decades after the Galactic Civil War. He was trained under Captain Phasma in the FN Corps alongside FN-2199 "Nines," FN-2003 "Slip," and FN-2187 "Eight-Seven." The four troopers practiced in simulated combat for most of their lives. During their first deployment, the FN Corps was brought to the mining facility in Pressy's Tumble, an asteroid field, and ordered to kill the miners that had gone on strike. Zeroes and Slip opened fire on the workers with FN-2187 refusing to shoot a Abednedo negotiator and Nines being at first reluctant to shoot but eventually followed orders.

FN-2000 was first introduced in the 2015 novel Before the Awakening, written by Greg Rucka. In the free-roam mode of LEGO Star Wars: The Force Awakens, FN-2000 appears on Takodana and is seen mourning FN-2199's passing during the battle. FN-2000 provides the player with a side mission, in which he asks the player to retrieve FN-2199's stun baton, which has been stolen by mercenaries residing on Takodana. Completing that mission awards the player with a gold brick.
